sections.heading: What Makes くれる Special?
sections.content:
くれる and くださる mean "give," but specifically when someone gives TO YOU or your in-group. This is different from あげる (give to others) and もらう (receive from others).

| Verb | Level | Meaning | | -------- | --------- | ----------------------- | | くれる | Neutral | Someone gives to me/us | | くださる | Honorific | Superior gives to me/us |

友達がプレゼントをくれた "My friend gave me a present" 先生が本をくださいました "My teacher gave me a book"

children.heading: あげる vs くれる
children.content:
あげる - I give to someone else:

私は友達にプレゼントをあげた "I gave a present to my friend" (Focus: My action of giving out)

くれる - Someone gives to me:

友達が私にプレゼントをくれた "My friend gave me a present" (Focus: Their action toward me)

children.heading: Basic Pattern
children.content:
Giver + が + (me/us) + に + Object + を + くれる

友達がプレゼントをくれた "My friend gave me a present" 母がお金をくれました "My mother gave me money" 彼がチョコレートをくれた "He gave me chocolate"

children.heading: Often Omits "Me"
children.content:
The "me" (私に) is usually omitted since it's obvious:

友達が(私に)プレゼントをくれた "My friend gave (me) a present"

sections.heading: くださる - Honorific "Give to Me"

children.heading: When to Use くださる
children.content:
1. Superiors give to you

先生が本をくださいました "My teacher gave me a book" 社長がアドバイスをくださった "The president gave me advice"

2. Customers/clients give to you

お客様がご意見をくださいました "The customer gave us feedback"

3. Showing respect

おばあさんがお小遣いをくださった "My grandmother gave me pocket money"

sections.heading: In-Group Extension
sections.content:
くれる can be used when someone gives to your family/in-group:

友達が弟にゲームをくれた "My friend gave my younger brother a game" 先生が妹に本をくださいました "The teacher gave my sister a book"

This shows you identify with your family member.

children.heading: Past Tense
children.content: くれた - gave (to me) くださった - gave (to me, honorific)

children.heading: Negative
children.content: くれない - won't give (to me) くださらない - won't give (to me, honorific)

children.heading: Request Form
children.content: くれる？ - Will you give me? くれますか？ - Will you give me? (polite) ください - Please give me くださいますか？ - Could you give me? (very polite)

children.heading: Pattern: Verb-て + くれる/くださる
children.content:
This means "someone does something FOR ME":

友達が手伝ってくれた "My friend helped me" 先生が教えてくださいました "My teacher taught me" 母が作ってくれた "My mother made it for me"

children.heading: Expressing Gratitude
children.content:
〜てくれる often expresses appreciation:

ありがとう、助けてくれて "Thanks for helping me" 来てくれてありがとう "Thanks for coming"

children.heading: 〜てくれる？ (Casual request)
children.content: 手伝ってくれる？ "Will you help me?" 教えてくれる？ "Will you teach me?"

children.heading: 〜てくれますか？ (Polite request)
children.content: 手伝ってくれますか？ "Will you help me?" 待っててくれますか？ "Will you wait for me?"

children.heading: 〜てください (Standard request)
children.content: 手伝ってください "Please help me" 教えてください "Please teach me"

children.heading: 〜てくださいますか？ (Very polite request)
children.content: お名前を教えてくださいますか？ "Could you tell me your name?" 説明してくださいますか？ "Could you explain?"

children.heading: Example 1: Friend's Help
children.content: A: 昨日手伝ってくれてありがとう "Thanks for helping me yesterday" B: どういたしまして "You're welcome" A: 本当に助かった "It really helped"

children.heading: Example 2: Gift
children.content: A: これ、あなたにあげる "I'll give this to you" B: 本当に？ありがとう！ "Really? Thank you!" A: 気に入ってくれるといいな "I hope you like it"

children.heading: Example 3: Teacher's Advice
children.content: A: 先生がアドバイスをくださいました "My teacher gave me advice" B: よかったですね "That's good" A: とても役に立ちました "It was very helpful"

sections.heading: Comparing the Three: あげる・もらう・くれる

children.heading: Same situation, three perspectives:
children.content:
あげる (I give):

私は友達にプレゼントをあげた "I gave a present to my friend"

もらう (I receive):

私は友達にプレゼントをもらった "I received a present from my friend"

くれる (They give to me):

友達が私にプレゼントをくれた "My friend gave me a present"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: くれる くれた くれない

children.heading: Polite
children.content: くれます くれました くれません

children.heading: Honorific
children.content: くださる くださいました くださいません

children.heading: Imperative
children.content: くれ (rough, masculine) ください (polite) くださいませ (very polite)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using くれる when YOU give
children.content: Wrong: 私が友達にプレゼントをくれた ❌ Right: 私が友達にプレゼントをあげた ✓ "I gave a present to my friend" くれる = someone gives TO ME, not from me!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using あげる when receiving
children.content: Wrong: 友達が私にプレゼントをあげた ❌ Right: 友達が私にプレゼントをくれた ✓ "My friend gave me a present"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong politeness level
children.content: Less polite: 先生が本をくれました ⚠️ Better: 先生が本をくださいました ✓ "My teacher gave me a book"

children.heading: Mistake 4: Omitting が particle
children.content: Unclear: 友達プレゼントをくれた ❌ Clear: 友達がプレゼントをくれた ✓ "My friend gave me a present"

children.heading: ありがとう、〜てくれて
children.content:
Common gratitude pattern:

来てくれてありがとう "Thanks for coming" 手伝ってくれてありがとう "Thanks for helping" 覚えていてくれてありがとう "Thanks for remembering"

children.heading: 〜てくれない？ (Won't you...?)
children.content:
Soft request:

ちょっと待ってくれない？ "Won't you wait a bit?" 一緒に来てくれない？ "Won't you come with me?"

children.heading: 〜てくれればいいのに
children.content:
Wish someone would do something:

もっと早く言ってくれればよかったのに "I wish you had told me earlier"

sections.heading: Comparison Chart
sections.content: | Situation | Verb | Example | | ---------------------- | ---------- | ---------------- | | I give to friend | あげる | 友達にあげた | | I receive from friend | もらう | 友達にもらった | | Friend gives to me | くれる | 友達がくれた | | I give to teacher | さしあげる | 先生にさしあげた | | I receive from teacher | いただく | 先生にいただいた | | Teacher gives to me | くださる | 先生がくださった |

children.heading: Away from me (あげる・さしあげる)
children.content: 私 → 友達 I give to friend

children.heading: Toward me (くれる・くださる)
children.content: 友達 → 私 Friend gives to me

children.heading: Neutral receiving (もらう・いただく)
children.content: 私 ← 友達 I receive from friend

sections.heading: When Not to Use くれる

children.heading: Don't use when you're the giver:
children.content: Wrong: 私がくれた ❌ Right: 私があげた ✓ "I gave"

children.heading: Don't use for unrelated third parties:
children.content: Unnatural: 田中さんが山田さんにくれた ⚠️ Better: 田中さんが山田さんにあげた ✓ "Tanaka gave to Yamada" (Unless Yamada is your in-group)

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 友達がプレゼントをくれた "My friend gave me a present" 先生が本をくださいました "My teacher gave me a book" 母が作ってくれた "My mother made it for me"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 手伝ってくれてありがとう "Thanks for helping me" 先生が推薦状を書いてくださいました "My teacher wrote a recommendation letter for me" 友達が駅まで送ってくれた "My friend took me to the station"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: みんなが応援してくれたおかげで、合格できました "Thanks to everyone's support, I was able to pass" お忙しい中、時間を割いてくださり、ありがとうございます "Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule" 彼女が最後まで信じてくれたことが、一番嬉しかった "What made me happiest was that she believed in me until the end"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Giving: あげる/やる/さしあげる - Giving to others Receiving: もらう/いただく - Receiving from others Direction of Actions - Perspective in giving 〜てくれる/〜てもらう - Doing favors Benefactive expressions - Helping/favoring ください - Polite requests

children.content: About Pricing Blog Contact

children.content: Privacy Policy Terms of Service Cookie Policy

Receiving: もらう/いただく - Receiving from others

〜てくれる/〜てもらう - Doing favors
